quote.quotepara: Now I found the SaxonServlet source code buried in a directory with the samples data (which came along with the original download of the Saxon program). But have been unable to get it to work. I followed the same syntax in the Saxon documentation and I cannot get it to work. I guess my question is - how do I get it to work? Is there some special settings I must set on our Sun machine? Does the servlet code have to be in a special directory?

body.para: Getting servlets to work is tricky, and the details depend on which servlet engine you are using. I've found that the jakarta/tomcat environment from Apache is easier than most. Install it and get to understand how its sample servlets work, then install the Saxon sample servlet in the same directory as the jakarta sample servlets.
